Resources


Please use these resources to simplify the process and make your finished product compliant with BYU-Idaho visualidentitystandards.


Quick Start Guide

This Quick Start Guide is a great resource to assist you in creating your communication piece.


Campus Resources

This document provides all the methods and contacts for campus publicity and communication.


Writing Resources

Here is a list of tools to help your writing remain consistent with other university communications:

  • Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary, 11th edition (available online at: http://unabridged.merriam-webster.com)
  • Chicago Manual of Style, 15th edition
  • University Terminology Guide (available online at: http://www.byui.edu/terminologyguide/default.htm)
  • Church Terminology Guide (available at LDS Distribution Centers)

Layout Templates

We have prepared templates for standards communication pieces. These files can be downloaded from here. Please use these files when preparing communication on behalf of the university.


Fonts

When possible use approved university fonts:

  • Minion Pro
  • News Gothic

If you do not own copies of these fonts, they may be purchased by contacting Doug Thompson in Technology Support and requesting the Adobe Type Classics suite (cost: $30). Though the cost is considerably higher, individual typefaces for both the Minion Pro and News Gothic Standard families can be purchased at:

  • http://www.adobe.com/type/

Times New Roman and Arial may be used as substitutes for the approved university fonts for lower profile communication.


You may want to use unique fonts on an on-campus promotional piece - use discretion.

[Design tip: give your poster style and personality with layout and images, not a variety of fonts]


Images

Photo Services (part of University Creative Services) maintains an extensive library of photos for campus communication. Requests for new photos can also be handled through Photo Services. For either service, write ucphotos@byui.edu or call Ext. 2980.


Places to find free images on the Internet (use caution when searching - results are not filtered and inappropriate images may be a part of your search results.):

  • http://morguefile.com
  • http://www.sxc.hu

These resources should not be used for off-campus communication, including the university's Web site.

Inexpensive images can be purchased at:

  • http://www.stockxpert.com
  • http://www.istockphoto.com
  • http://www.gettyimages.com

Logos

Requests for university logo files may be obtained by contacting University Communications at ucidentity@byui.edu.


Training and Support

As you work on creative ideas for promotion and then move to design, printing, and distribution, please direct any questions to ucidentity@byui.edu.


Communication Council representatives

As you prepare publicity for your event or program, spend some time with your Communication Council representative. They are available to help you communicate within the university's written and visualidentitystandards.


Creative Services

If you need special help with your project, contact Creative Services. They can help answer your questions or point you to the correct resources. Creative Services can be reached at ucprojects@byui.edu and Ext. 2980.



Questions? Send us an e-mail: ucidentity@byui.edu
